intro: Pinalia distans, commonly known as the distant pinyon, is a member of the Cupressaceae family, which includes cypresses and junipers. It is a small evergreen shrub or tree that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its scale-like leaves and small, cone-like fruits that contain seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments with limited water availability. The botanical features of Pinalia distans make it an important species in ecological studies of drought-resistant flora.
